org.platanios.learn.math.matrix

Class SparseVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.math.matrix.Vector
      • org.platanios.learn.math.matrix.SparseVector

  • public class SparseVector
extends Vector
    Implements a class representing sparse vectors and supporting operations related to them. The sparse vector is stored in two internal parallel arrays: one holding the indexes of the nonzero elements of the vector, and one holding the values of the corresponding vector elements. Note that the indexes array is sorted and therefore, changing values of this vector's elements is a slow, O(n), operation, when n is the number of nonzero elements of the vector. Retrieving elements from this vector is an O(log(n)) operation (binary search is used). TODO: Make unsafe versions of all the methods. Performs binary search to retrieve elements within the vector.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow.

    • Field Detail

      • size

        protected final int size
        The size of the vector.

      • numberOfNonzeroEntries

        protected int numberOfNonzeroEntries
        The cardinality of the vector (i.e., the number of nonzero elements of the vector). This value also limits the effective length of indexes and values (i.e., only the first numberOfNonzeroEntries elements of those two arrays are ever used -- the rest of the values are considered to be equal to zero).

      • indexes

        protected int[] indexes
        Integer array for internal storage of the indexes of the non-zero vector elements. This array is always ordered and is "parallel" to the values array.

      • values

        protected double[] values
        Double array for internal storage of the values of the non-zero vector elements. This array is always "parallel" to the indexes array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(int size)
        Constructs a sparse vector of the given size and fills it with zeros.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the vector.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(int size,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> vectorElements)
        Constructs a sparse vector of the given size and fills it with the values stored in the provided map. The map must contain key-value pairs where the key corresponds to an element index and the value to the corresponding element's value. Note that the map does not need to be an sorted map; all the necessary sorting is performed within this constructor.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the vector.
        vectorElements - The map containing the vector indexes and values used to initialize the values of the elements of this vector.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(int size,
                    int[] indexes,
                    double[] values)
        Constructs a sparse vector of the given size from the provided parallel arrays containing indexes of vector elements and the values corresponding to those indexes.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the vector.
        indexes - Integer array containing the indexes of the vector elements for which values are provided. This array is "parallel" to the values array, which is also provided as a parameter to this constructor.
        values - Double array containing the values of the vector elements that correspond to the indexes provided in the indexes parameter to this constructor. This array is "parallel" to the values array, which is also provided as a parameter to this constructor.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(int size,
                    int numberOfNonzeroEntries,
                    int[] indexes,
                    double[] values)
        Constructs a sparse vector of the given size from the provided parallel arrays containing indexes of vector elements and the values corresponding to those indexes. Only the first numberOfNonzeroEntries elements of the provided parallel arrays are used and the rest are considered to be equal to zero. This mechanism is used (as opposed to simply resizing the parallel arrays) for time efficiency reasons. Resizing the arrays is slow and the memory cost can generally be considered small.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the vector.
        numberOfNonzeroEntries - The number of elements to consider as corresponding to nonzero vector values in the provided parallel arrays. This number also corresponds to the number of nonzero elements (i.e., the cardinality) of the sparse vector being constructed.
        indexes - Integer array containing the indexes of the vector elements for which values are provided. This array is "parallel" to the values array, which is also provided as a parameter to this constructor.
        values - Double array containing the values of the vector elements that correspond to the indexes provided in the indexes parameter to this constructor. This array is "parallel" to the values array, which is also provided as a parameter to this constructor.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(DenseVector vector)
        Constructs a sparse vector from a dense vector. This constructor does not simply transform the dense vector structure into a sparse vector structure, but it also throws away elements of the dense vector that have a value effectively 0 (i.e., absolute value \(<\epsilon\), where \(\epsilon\) is the square root of the smallest possible value that can be represented by a double precision floating point number).
        Parameters:
        vector - The dense vector from which to construct this sparse vector.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(SparseVector vector)
        Constructs a sparse vector from another sparse vector. This constructor basically constructs a copy of the provided sparse vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - The sparse vector from which to construct this sparse vector.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(HashVector vector)
        Constructs a sparse vector from another hash vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - The hash vector from which to construct this sparse vector.

      • SparseVector

        public SparseVector(java.io.ObjectInputStream inputStream)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a sparse vector from the contents of the provided input stream. Note that the contents of the stream must have been written using the writeToStream(java.io.ObjectOutputStream) method of this class in order to be compatible with this constructor. If the contents are not compatible, then an IOException might be thrown, or the constructed vector might be corrupted in some way.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input stream to read the contents of the vector to be constructed from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saxpy

        public SparseVector saxpy(double scalar,
                          Vector vector)
        Performs the saxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a scalar \(\alpha\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Specified by:
        saxpy in class Vector
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar \(\alpha\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • saxpyInPlace

        public SparseVector saxpyInPlace(double scalar,
                                 Vector vector)
        Performs the saxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK, in-place. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a scalar \(\alpha\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function replaces this vector with the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns it.
        Specified by:
        saxpyInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar \(\alpha\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • hypotenuse

        public SparseVector hypotenuse(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The result is returned in a new vector. This method is slower than Vector.hypotenuseFast(Vector), but it tries to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuseFast(Vector) does not.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuse in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseInPlace

        public SparseVector hypotenuseInPlace(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The current vector is replaced with the result. This method is slower than Vector.hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector), but it tries to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector) does not.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuseInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        The current vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseFast

        public SparseVector hypotenuseFast(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The result is returned in a new vector. This method is faster than Vector.hypotenuse(Vector), but it does not try to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuse(Vector) does try to avoid such errors.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuseFast in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The current vector is replaced with the result. This method is faster than Vector.hypotenuseInPlace(Vector), but it does not try to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuseInPlace(Vector) does try to avoid such errors.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuseFastInPlace in class Vector

      • map

        public SparseVector map(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function)
        Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and returns it in a new vector. The function is assumed to return 0 when applied to 0. Therefore, it is only applied to the nonzero elements of this vector.
        Specified by:
        map in class Vector
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of the operation.

      • mapBiFunction

        public SparseVector mapBiFunction(java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function,
                                  Vector vector)
        Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and the provided vector (the elements of the two vectors with the same index are considered in pairs) and returns it in a new vector. The function is assumed to return 0 when both of its arguments are 0. Therefore, it is only applied when either one or both of the two vector values are nonzero for a each index.
        Specified by:
        mapBiFunction in class Vector
        Parameters:
        function - The function to apply to the current vector element-wise.
        vector - The vector to use for second argument of the function.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of the operation.

      • mapDivElementwise

        public SparseVector mapDivElementwise(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function,
                                      Vector vector)
        Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and dividing the provided vector with the result element-wise, and returns it in a new vector. The function is assumed to return 0 when applied to 0. Therefore, it is only applied to the nonzero elements of this vector. Cases where we have division by 0 are not considered. For those cases the returned result is 0 and so the user of this class should take care to avoid such cases on his own.
        Specified by:
        mapDivElementwise in class Vector
        Parameters:
        function - The function to apply to the current vector element-wise.
        vector - The vector to divide with the function result element-wise.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of the operation.

The function is assumed to return 0 when applied to 0. Therefore, it is only applied to the nonzero elements of this vector. Cases where we have division by 0 are not considered. For those cases the returned result is 0 and so the user of this class should take care to avoid such cases on his own.
        Specified by:

      • gaxpy

        public Vector gaxpy(Matrix matrix,
                    Vector vector)
        Performs the gaxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(\A\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Specified by:
        gaxpy in class Vector
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(\A\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • gaxpyInPlace

        public Vector gaxpyInPlace(Matrix matrix,
                           Vector vector)
        Performs the gaxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK, in-place. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(A\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function replaces this vector with the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns it.
        Specified by:
        gaxpyInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(A\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • transMult

        public Vector transMult(Matrix matrix)
        Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(\A\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}^{\top}A\).
        Specified by:
        transMult in class Vector
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(A\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}^{\top}A\).

      • compact

        public SparseVector compact()
        This method compacts this vector. Compacting in this case is the process of removing elements that are effectively equal to 0 (i.e., absolute value \(<\epsilon\), where \(\epsilon\) is the square root of the smallest possible value that can be represented by a double precision floating point number) from the two parallel arrays used to store the sparse vector internally.
        Returns:
        The current vector after the compacting operation is completed.

                   throws java.io.IOException

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Compares the current vector with another object for equality. Note that if the provided object is not a vector object, then this method returns false. Otherwise, it checks for equality of the element values of the two vectors, with some tolerance that is equal to the square root of the smallest possible value that can be represented by a double precision floating point number. That tolerance is used because double precision floating point number values are compared.
        Specified by:
        equals in class Vector
        Parameters:
        object - The object with which to compare this vector.
        Returns:
        True if this vector is equal to the provided object and false if it is not.
